name: BITTER
eg: Citrus peel, unsweetened cocoa, black coffee, tea, kale.

name: NUMBING
desc: A tingling sensation, usually associated with the loss of other sensations.

name: SALTY
desc: A taste sensation suggestive of seawater.
eg: Salt, fish sauce, soy sauce, miso

name: SOUR
desc: A tart or tangy taste sensation produced chiefly by acids.
eg: Citrus fruits, vinegar, tart cherries or apples.

name: SPICY
desc: A tingling sensation, technically not a taste, rather a form of pain sensation

name: SWEET
desc: A taste sensation described as pleasant and having the characteristics of sugar or honey.

name: UMAMI
desc: A Savory sensation produced by the presence of glutamates and nucleotides and usually associated with meats and other high-protein foods.
eg: Cheese, miso, worcestershire sauce, grilled meats, tomato paste
